properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Periods of snow will continue tonight along the Haines-Skagway Road. Strong southerly winds causing blowing snow is leading to significantly reduced visibilities. The strongest winds and lowest visibilities will be near Chilkat Pass. The strong winds are expected to abate after midnight. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-02T22:17:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-02T08:10:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0504649047.2020
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow will continue tonight into Monday. Total snowfall accumulations near 15 cm can be expected by the time the snow tapers off Monday afternoon. The snow is from a low pressure area moving east across the region. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-02T19:28:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-02T03:29:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3793601501.2020
Area: Webequie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: 2 to 4 millimetres of freezing precipitation is expected beginning this evening. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-03T07:58:10-00:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor weather will occur over Eastern Quebec midweek... A low pressure system will intensify over the Gulf of St. Lawrence on Wednesday. It could bring heavy snowfall accompanied by very strong winds giving blowing snow over the Gaspe Peninsula and the North Shore. The Southern Gaspe Peninsula could also see a period of rain or freezing rain. Conditions should gradually improve on Thursday. The poor weather conditions could delay transportation. Please consider modifying any non essential travel plan. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-02T20:34:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-02T04:35:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4205091565.2020

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: In general, 2 to 5 millimetres of freezing precipitation is expected and possibly up to 10 millimetres locally in areas between Lachute and Lanaudiere beginning Monday afternoon or evening. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. There may be a significant impact on rush hour traffic in urban areas. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-02T20:33:08-00:00

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. A ridge of high pressure in-line with the Mackenzie River will remain nearly stationary today, driving strong easterly winds through the Richardson Mountains. Blizzard conditions are expected to persist through to this evening. ### Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-03T05:04:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-02T13:05:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3800345430.2020
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong winds have developed this evening with gusts up to and possibly exceeding 100 km/h in wind prone areas. Winds should taper off Monday morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-02T19:26:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-02T03:28:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1737481454.2020

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. The coldest wind chill values will be between minus 55 and minus 60. Extreme cold wind chill values will continue today and Tuesday. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-03T09:19:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-02T17:20:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3365268413.2020
Area: Sachs Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain expected this afternoon. An area of freezing rain will move across Eastern Ontario this afternoon, causing a thin glaze of ice to develop on untreated surfaces. The commute home from work this afternoon may be affected as a result. The precipitation will change over to rain by evening as milder air arrives and temperatures inch above the zero degree mark. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-03T03:59:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-02T16:21:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2011968150.2020
Area: Prescott and Russell

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The coldest wind chill values will be between minus 55 and minus 60. Extreme cold wind chill values will persist this morning. ### Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-02T23:20:24-00:00

Area: Cambridge Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southwesterly winds are expected to persist today. With periods of falling snow, blizzard conditions are again expected for much of the day. Winds should ease somewhat by this evening. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A frontal system will move across northern BC tonight. Snow associated with the system will begin late this afternoon and taper off to flurries after midnight. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-03T04:13:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-02T12:14:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2258115469.2020
Area: Highway 97 - Pine Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain possible this afternoon. Precipitation approaching from the southwest may arrive as a brief period of freezing rain this afternoon, especially for areas near the Ottawa River. The freezing rain may cause untreated surfaces such as roads, walkways and parking lots to become icy and slippery. There may be some impact on the commute home from work this afternoon. Precipitation is expected to change over to rain by late afternoon as temperatures inch above the zero degree mark. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-03T03:59:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-02T16:20:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3086810597.2020
Area: Gatineau, Ottawa North - Kanata - Orléans
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A snowstorm is expected. Additional snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northeasterly 60 km/h. Locations: St. John's and vicinity and the Southern Shore Time span: continuing until this afternoon. Remarks: Snow will taper to flurries this afternoon. In the mean time, strong northerly winds will continue to cause reduced visibility in blowing snow over some locations. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-02T19:59:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-02T14:22:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3290337697.2020
Area: St. John's and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada
